title: Is not playing Jungle a bannable offense?
body:
Just played a game of Normal Draft with a group of 3 guys. I was sup as Zilean with the other solo on bot as jhin. Didn't notice till the game started that our assigned jungle player instead went riven top lane and doubled with kled, meaning we had no jungler. She also swapped off her smite. The third guy, Ryze mid, actually played his role. Is this a bannable/reportable offense? By that I mean signing up to be a jungler in a Draft matchup then refusing to jungle by taking off your smite and never actually jungling?  
Not to mention the Riven basically told us to cry about it and tried to use the classic "It's just norms" excuse.

replies.body:
If Kled was fine with sharing the lane with Riven I doubt it's bannable.
But if he wasn't fine with it, then it's griefing, which is bannable offense.

No,  griefing is deliberately hurting the riven's feelings and trolling,  and going duo top is evidence of that if you troll or if you don't communicate.  I got news for you,  miss fortune support used to be griefing too before they played it at worlds and ap yi mid was before faker did it in worlds so have some respect.

> [{quoted}](name=Brony Gaymer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=H1Fo4qL4,comment-id=00040001,timestamp=2019-02-18T15:32:37.757+0000)
>
> No,  griefing is deliberately hurting the riven's feelings and trolling,  and going duo top is evidence of that if you troll or if you don't communicate.  I got news for you,  miss fortune support used to be griefing too before they played it at worlds and ap yi mid was before faker did it in worlds so have some respect.

Ok and? We're talking about riven going top with kled, not about off-meta bs.
You're missing the point.  Riven going top with Kled is fine even if you think it's not meta.

> [{quoted}](name=Brony Gaymer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=H1Fo4qL4,comment-id=0004000100000000,timestamp=2019-02-18T18:14:13.668+0000)
>
> You're missing the point.  Riven going top with Kled is fine even if you think it's not meta.

Not that it's not meta, but if Kled didn't agree with it it would be considered griefing. I'm all for duo top as long as every1 are fine with it (mainly the one who's assigned top).

No,  players can't judge each other for what is griefing or not during the game,   every player is responsible for themselves, not their peers.  We used to have a tribunal but we ditched that for a reason ;)

> [{quoted}](name=Brony Gaymer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=H1Fo4qL4,comment-id=000400010000000000000000,timestamp=2019-02-18T21:50:28.781+0000)
>
> No,  players can't judge each other for what is griefing or not during the game,   every player is responsible for themselves, not their peers.  We used to have a tribunal but we ditched that for a reason ;)

By your logic "Disco Nunu" wouldnt be griefing xD

Btw disco nunu implies going afk,  wiffing your ult,  putting up a blue ward and dancing in the sparkles because it sounds like you probably don't even know about that.  Afking, antagonizing and throwing a game is griefing.  Sending 2, 3 or however many into a lane can be done for other reasons as demonstrated by sending two people bot lane.  If you nerfed dragons and made rift herald way more amazing we would start sending 2 top all the time,  ;)

Oh please, it isn't "my" logic it's ours.  The bulk of the league community.   And no, Disco Nunu is stronger evidence of trolling and there is no reason to take that seriously . Kled and Riven top is another matter and if you can't figure out why then you should revisit this issue when you are more experienced.  ;)
I think the whole team should be fine with that, as not having jungle will affect all the team.
That's like saying not having anything else will affect all the team,  you didn't make a point.
we are talking specifically about not having jungle, so yes not having any other assgined role will affect all the team

Any change will affect the team as a whole and there are both practical and theoretical arguments to be had over whether the change is favorable or not.
You still didn't make a point.
you still didn't make a point
No,  I have certainly made two great points and shared some class wisdom.
ok your last reply proved me this conversation is useless and you are nothing but a waste of my time

Ok, I believe you really did miss them and don't have ulterior motives.  The stated point was that even if you think that a location of resources is bad,  in this case riven going top with Kled,  practice (what happens in a large sample size of games) and Theory (Number crunching and arguing over forums / boards and between coaches and players) will prove or disprove as much and the implied point was that you don't know enough to make that call in game.  You don't judge the meta , counter meta or future meta while you are playing in game.  I amicably ask you to try to be the best teammate you can be and try your best to be laid back, kind and confident all of the time!
Any change will affect the team as a whole and there are both practical and theoretical arguments to be had over whether the change is favorable or not.

Kled was grouped with him. The problem is Riven then went 0-8-1 on lane phase, feeding their jungler. And when you have a fed JV4 jungle when you don't have a jungle it makes for a really annoying game.
if it was their strategy then its not bannable
Even if Riven signed up to play jungle??

yes since it was a plan between kled and riven its like when jungler is camping a single lane all game, even if that camping is a bad idea its still his strategy. (just think of it as your jungler is *camping* top and play according to that)

Yes, flex picks are a thing and often depend on what was picked later in the draft phase or how the game develops.  You not liking what the riven does isn't an excuse to assume the worst of them, become toxic, adopt a bad attitude or give up on the game.  Worry about yourself and do your best with what you have.

Not punishable in any way, meta is not enforced.

Usually the people losing their minds about it do far more harm than people playing offmeta.

But this isn't about the meta. This is about being ASSIGNED jungle by the matchmaking, then just saying "nah I'll go top lane." It's just another variation of people saying "well I main top but got put as sup, I'll just go top anyways and ignore my teammates raging." 
Even though Ryze was in their group, he begged for her to go jg and she refused. So it was three of us wanting her to jungle, but she refused and continued to die 8 times in lane phase.
Yes,  that is riot's official stance on it.

**It is bannable.**
Not going to assigned role in draft is bannable offense.
History disagrees with you.
yet Riot agrees
If you have played jungle recently you would know why some people are opting for double top.
This man knows what's up
No jg and 2 top while people would take a camp every now and then used to be meta.
Yes,  this and lane swaps are normal, there was even a meta where you had level 1 roaming blitzcrank support who never went to lane

Off Meta sometimes suits the match - if you've got a powerful premade on top(for example Zoe and Lux), which suits eachother well, it can work out
However, in this situation.
No.
This is pure, and hard griefing. Unless the enemy teams jungler bailed to top, I would never personally do this since it puts the team at an INCREDIBLE disadvantage for baron/dragon/rift, and prevents our team from stealing it easily.
The fact they told you to "cry about it" shows their toxic nature

Unfortunately, riot will not do anything.

My condolences for your ruined game.

EDIT:
Read down, I would like to reiterate on my point.
Two top can snowball extremely early, but can be a disadvantage towards the end(cs bounty ect) and as said, if the enemy jungler doesnt bail top its just a 2v1 all game, which may lead to you and your other teammate being 1-2 levels behind(and gold splitting, which is all types of fckery)

For example, on how off meta is good, Crit Heca w/ ms in urf(support)
Stattik, Ghostblade + Ghost, Predator.
1200 m/s at level 10, 25% crit by default, can go to 50% with phantom dance.
You quickly go from early game easy kill from stomping at 6
{{champion:98}} {{summoner:3}} {{summoner:14}}

I mean. You actually may as wel have a duo top and a duo bot each with smite and take jungle camps for extra carry gold. 

The entire role is fucked. If you arenâ€™t hard farming while invading atleast 3 camps you are always 3 levels behind top and mid. And if you do invade 3+ camps you now have a 450 gold bounty per clear.

No,  you have to go into the draft accepting that you were placed jungle but you can make strategic decisions going forward.  Like a top laner who got dumpstered in lane might want to go bot lane against vayne braum and punish their low wave clear with allied lux ezreal and trade the tower before going top to safely farm at the tier 2 tower and maybe get gromp wolves if they're lucky or a mid laner might want to dodge out of mid, as kat, against ziggs to roam.  But what is important is that you show a real want to win the game and the weirder your strategy is the more explaining you have to do and maybe pings aren't enough.
I can tell from his comments in game her definitely did NOT want to win. He tried using the "normals" excuse but he was just trolling in the end.
